707650f-b.title: Manhattan: 1st Ave. - 67th St. E.
707650f-b.text:
First Avenue, east side, from East 67th to 68th Streets,
showing the New York Trade School occupying this avenue frontage.
This structure was rased about 1932 and the new Memorial Hospital
for the Treatment of Cancer and Allied Diseases erected during
1939. View 2 is an eastward view of the new building. This extends
to York Avenue, beyond which appear the buildin. s of the Rockefeller
Institute for Medical Research.
Note the bus on 68th Street slightly east of First Avenue.
View 1: Septmmber 7, 1927
View 2: April 10, 1940
P. L. Sperr
NO REPPODUCTIONS

707647f-a.title: Manhattan: 1st Ave. - 67th St. E.
707647f-a.text:
First Ave., at the S.E. corner of East 67th Street. Also shown is East
67th Street, south side, east from First to and including York Aves. The
view shows the Bethany Memorial Church, occupying the corner site, with the
nursery (402 East 67th Street), adjoining it.
September 15, 1927.
P. L. Sperr.
NO EEPRODUCTIONS.

707649f.title: Manhattan: 1st Ave. - 67th St. E.
707649f.text:
First Avenue, at the S. E. corner of East 67th
Street showing the Bethany Memorial Church and its
5 story nurscry (No. 402 E.).
This is given in the Gity Record Supolement
as being owned by the Mauison Avenue Reformed Church.
To the right a,pears a portion of the St. John Napomuk
Roman Catholic Church at oth Street.
October 22, 1939
C;ift of George Jiranek
New York Public Library
Photostat Division
MAY BE REPRODUCED

707648f-b.title: Manhattan: 1st Ave. - 67th St. E.
707648f-b.text:
(1)
First Ave., east side, north from East 67th Street. Also shown
(across clearance for park), is Bast 68th Street, north side, east from
First, to, but not including York Aves. Notc the smoke stack of the
New York Hospital and Cornell Medical College, on the right.
September 25, 1935.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
(2)
From the same point of view, but further eastward, and showing
the Medical Centre here in its entity. Street shown on the extreme
right, is East 67th Street.
September 25, 1935.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.

723094f-a.title: Manhattan: 1st Avenue - 67th Street (East)
723094f-a.text:
St. Catherines Park: Children playing in the undeveloped
playground prior to its later formal arrangement. This site
utilizes the west frontage of Pirst Avenue from E. 67th to
68th Street's. Dpon the latter appears the German Reformed
Protestant N. Church (translation of the inscription over
the west door). Bromleys Nap of 1922 gives this organiza-
tion as the German Evang. Reformed Church. The parsonage
at the right bears No. 355 Last 68th Street.
